reviewText: ABSOLUTELY THE BEST !!!!Learn signing....it helps so much and it is great for brain development and communication b4 they can speakput on the subtitles and learn letters and reading as wellthe really young babes learn to talk and sign....convenient when they need to communicate but can not yet say the words!!! Especially when sick or hurt..no more Guess whats wrong ?? to make you even more nervous !! Gotta love signing then !But they do learn to speak from this as well ..yAY!!!Costly if you buy all at once so buy a few at a time Start with #1 and go on from there.I read the signs that each DVD teaches and go from there with signs I want him to know first, not always in orderAmazon gives a great description of each DVDI have the whole DVD set  but only one book and 3 sets of Flash cards......like them but do not use as much as i thought I wouldYou learn with child so YOU can be the 'flash card"  and they can tell you what you just signed or at a pre-talking age you say the word you want them to sign and they sign it.Clap and shout 'YES!" affirms them and makes them want to keep on learning....do it your way of course, mine is just our way of affirming that he responds to."good job' works as well I'm sureKeeps interest, real kids, Rachel, cartoon characters,Rachel singing songs that stick in your head (NOOOOOO) but stick in little ones heads as well and ...iT JUST WORKS !!!! And magnificently so !!!I have never seen him not enamored by this seriesGreat for older kids as wellas I said you learn the signing , reading  , speaking etcbut once  the English is knownuSE SPANISH version and you know basic words in Spanish !!!Don't forget the subtitles, very helpful!!if you go to buy entire set SEARCH on eBay  there is a site that sells at half price Just keep on looking  Usually the price is $189.00 I believe for first half which is over 10 dVDS plusSearch Amazon as well as they may sell on bothIf I had the name Id shareI hope I have helped !! This is the best I have seen and teaches soo many extras (like Spanish and reading when subtitles are used as well as talking for younger ones)
Title: N/A

reviewText: I got this for my 2 year old son. We used to watch some of the Baby Einstein DVDs that had sign language incorporated, but he much prefers this movie! He gets excited by the upbeat music, he loves seeing the other kids demonstrate the signs, and because the vocab is mostly words that are already familiar to him (when spoken) he gets really into it. Especially "brush teeth" and "comb hair". Of course, he does the signs in his own unique way-- for brush teeth he sticks his finger into his mouth as if brushing molars instead of just going side to side in front of his lips, lol. He's learned a few signs already after seeing the DVD just a few times. Sign language aside, he enjoys watching the kids and it teaches about other things like dressing for the weather, waking up and getting ready (brush teeth, hair, etc). I'm going to order more from this series! Next stop "Play Time Signs".
Title: N/A

reviewText: Don't get me wrong -- Signing Time is wonderful!!  All of the Signing Time videos we've purchased have been excellent.  One extra nice thing about this one is that the music is low-key, so that it doesn't keep you awake at night when a song is stuck in your head!  Rachel makes learning ASL so easy -- she explains the signs so well that they are easy to remember.  And watching her sing/speak and sign is fun and interesting, as you can try to pick up signs while watching.  My only criticism of this video (hence the 4 stars) is that she does some talking at the end without signing -- a disappointment!And, I would love it if Signing Time would put out a video that teaches ASL "grammar," if there is such a thing (how do you actually converse in ASL??) -- Or maybe provide it in the form of an instructional add-on.
summary: Four Stars - Against a Higher Standard

reviewText: We love these videos. They are a great way to learn some sign language. They could be a bit cheaper though; I would buy more of them.

reviewText: The particular volume is extremely helpful for daily activities. Having a 5 year old this video has helped us learn many signs that as parents we say alot! Knowing signs for the mundane can be less mundane and often times fun. Signs taught range from getting up and brushing/flossing teeth, to going to bed and everything in between. The songs are fun and my daughter's favorite is Imagination. A suberb video for families wanting to learn American Sign language. We highly recommend them!
Title: N/A

reviewText: One of our family favorites, and not just because my youngest son is in this, signing "Good Night" after Rachel shows the sign! This is a great DVD that introduces the ASL vocabulary for day to day things like 'Good Morning', getting dressed, brushing teeth (and flossing) as well as many other ideas such as pretending, cleaning up, and bed time. My son has Down syndrome and verbal apraxia, and when he has trouble saying the words 'shirt' and 'shorts', he can sign them along with saying them to help clarify his choices.
